data.subject: Endless-Nodes
data.question: What is Endless-Nodes and what does it do?
data.answer: Endless-Nodes is a set of custom nodes for the ComfyUI user interface for Stable Diffusion that extends its functionality. It includes features such as an image saver, aesthetic scoring models, converters, switches, and parameter collection nodes.

data.subject: Endless-Nodes Image Saver
data.question: What are the features of the Endless-Nodes Image Saver?
data.answer: The Endless-Nodes Image Saver allows saving images and JSON files to the base folder, custom folders for one or both, and supports Python timestamping. Moreover, it enables turning off JSON add to Image Metadata if a user chooses.

data.subject: Aesthetic Scorer and Image Reward
data.question: What are the Aesthetic Scorer and Image Reward in Endless-Nodes?
data.answer: Aesthetic Scorer and Image Reward are nodes in Endless-Nodes that output predicted aesthetic scores as numbers. They are based on different models: the first uses the AUTO1111 model, while the second is based on Image Reward, which uses Reward Feedback Learning (ReFL) and 137K human-scored input samples. They add around 7-10 seconds to a workflow on average.

data.subject: Endless Nodes Parameterizer
data.question: What does the Endless Nodes Parameterizer node do?
data.answer: The Endless Nodes Parameterizer collects inputs for the CLIP text Encoder and Refiners for SDXL based workflows. It includes settings for base and refiner resolution and provides separate aesthetic score values for positive and negative CLIPs.

data.subject: Endless Nodes Installation
data.question: How do I install Endless-Nodes?
data.answer: To install Endless-Nodes, navigate to your /ComfyUI/custom_nodes/ folder, right-click to start a command prompt and type 'git clone https://github.com/tusharbhutt/Endless-Nodes'. Alternatively, you can get the nodes via the [ComfyUI Manager](https://github.com/ltdrdata/ComfyUI-Manager).

data.subject: Endless Nodes License
data.question: What is the license for Endless-Nodes and are there any usage restrictions?
data.answer: Endless-Nodes is licensed under GPL Licensing V3. Users may modify the code, but must keep the credits for this repository and those noted in the credit section. Additionally, the nodes may not be used to create any images or artwork that violates the Stable Diffusion usage notes, including the creation of fake celebrity nudes or sexual content of any person, even with consent.
